Kecelakaan, Jungkook BTS Akui Bersalah usai Tabrak Taksi
04 Nov 2019, 16:08 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Jungkook BTS disebut mengakui melakukan pelanggaran lalu lintas yang menyebabkan kecelakaan pada akhir pekan lalu. (dok. Twitter BTS)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Salah satu member BTS, Jungkook memenuhi panggilan kepolisian dan menjalani pemeriksaan usai terlibat dalam sebuah kecelakaan mobil, akhir pekan lalu.Melansir Soompi, Kepolisian Yongsan telah memanggil dan menanyai Jungkook pada Senin (4/11). Ia dituduh melanggar UU Lalu Lintas ketika mengendarai mobil Mercedes-Benz di lingkungan Hannam di Distrik Yongsan dan menabrak taksi. Baik Jungkook maupun sopir taksi sempat menerima perawatan di rumah sakit akibat memar-memar.Sebuah sumber kepolisian menyebut detail lebih lanjut belum bisa diungkapkan. Namun pihak agensi BTS, Big Hit Entertainment merilis sebuah pernyataan resmi pada Senin (4/11)."Ini adalah pernyataan menanggapi kecelakaan mobil yang melibatkan Jungkook. Kepolisian belum menutup kasus ini, jadi kami tak bisa memaparkan detail lanjutan, tetapi Jungkook sedang mengendarai mobilnya minggu lalu ketika ia mengalami tabrakan kecil dengan kendaraan lain yang disebabkan oleh kesalahan Jungkook," kata Big Hit."Korban dan Jungkook tidak mengalami cedera parah. Setelah kecelakaan itu, Jungkook mengakui ia melanggar peraturan lalu lintas. Lokasi kecelakaan langsung ditangani [polisi] dan polisi juga sudah memeriksanya [Jungkook], dan [kasus] telah diselesaikan secara kekeluargaan dengan korban,""Sekali lagi kami meminta maaf kepada korban, serta penggemar karena telah menimbulkan kekhawatiran."Jungkook sendiri merupakan member termuda BTS. Bersama grupnya itu, ia baru saja menyelesaikan tur dunia bertajuk 'Love Yourself: Speak Yourself'. Tur dunia tersebut mencatat beberapa pencapaian bagi BTS. Salah satunya adalah menjadi artis non-Arab pertama yang menyelenggarakan konser di King Fahd International Stadium, Arab Saudi. Sementara di konser penutup yang digelar di Seoul, BTS berhasil mengumpulkan 132,000 penonton selama tiga hari penyelenggaraannya. (kir/rea)

Accident, Jungkook BTS Admits Guilty after Hit-and-Hit Taxi
Nov 04 2019, 16:08 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Jungkook BTS is said to admit committing a traffic violation which caused an accident at the end of last week. (doc. Twitter BTS)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - One of the BTS members, Jungkook fulfilled a police call and underwent an examination after being involved in a car accident, last weekend. Launching Soompi, Yongsan Police have summoned and questioned Jungkook on Monday (4/11). He was accused of violating the Traffic Law when driving a Mercedes-Benz car in the Hannam neighborhood in the Yongsan District and crashing into a taxi. Both Jungkook and the taxi driver had received treatment at the hospital due to bruises. A police source said further details could not be disclosed. But the BTS agency, Big Hit Entertainment released an official statement on Monday (4/11). "This is a statement responding to a car accident involving Jungkook. The police have not closed the case, so we cannot expose further details, but Jungkook is driving his car. last week when he suffered a minor collision with another vehicle caused by Jungkook's mistake, "said Big Hit." The victim and Jungkook were not seriously injured. After the accident, Jungkook admitted he violated traffic rules. The location of the accident was immediately handled by [police] and the police have also examined [Jungkook], and [the case] has been settled amicably with the victim, "" Once again we apologize to the victim, as well as fans for causing concern. "Jungkook himself is the youngest member of BTS. Together with the group, he recently completed a world tour titled 'Love Yourself: Speak Yourself'. The world tour recorded several achievements for BTS. One of them was to become the first non-Arab artist to hold a concert at King Fahd International Stadium, Saudi Arabia. While at the closing concert which was held in Seoul, BTS managed to gather 132,000 spectators over the three days of the event. (kir / rea)
